intro: Isoetes echinospora f. flettii, commonly known as the Flett's spiny watermilfoil, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the order Isoetales. It is characterized by its finely divided, ribbon-like leaves that are typically submerged in water. The plant is native to specific regions of Canada and is often found in shallow, freshwater habitats such as lakes and ponds. Its spores are produced in specialized structures called sporangia, which are clustered on the upper surface of the leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
